Question
========

According to the World Bank, about 45% of all rural people in China had less than €1 a day to spend in 1990. Suppose you repeatedly take a sample of 100 rural Chinese and you count the number of people who had less than €1 to spend that day. Then what is the mean and standard deviation of this distribution?

Answerlist
----------

* Mean 0.45, standard deviation 0.2475
* Mean 45, standard deviation 0.2475
* Mean 45, standard deviation 0.4975
* Mean 45, standard deviation 4.975
* Mean 45, standard deviation 24.75

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Mean 0.45, standard deviation 0.2475: Incorrect
* Mean 45, standard deviation 0.2475: Incorrect
* Mean 45, standard deviation 0.4975: Incorrect
* Mean 45, standard deviation 4.975: Correct
* Mean 45, standard deviation 24.75: Incorrect
